summary: This document is a series of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 10, 2019. It records scheduled staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, with signature blocks for different watch commanders. The document is significant as it pertains to the facility's operational procedures on the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for reviewing the check sheets for the morning watch shift.

persons.name: Day Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the day watch shift, with a signature block on the check sheet.

persons.name: Evening Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the evening watch shift, with a signature block on the check sheet.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The superior officer who reviewed the check sheets, as indicated at the bottom of each page.

events.title: Routine Inmate Checks at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Standard 30-minute observational checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) were conducted throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a procedural log showing 30-minute inmate checks in the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019.
It specifies a protocol requiring staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document is part of the prison's operational records from the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
